meanings.definition: Window coverings that block out light.
meanings.sent1: The blinds in my room keep the sunlight from waking me up too early.
meanings.sent2: She closed the blinds to darken the room for her nap.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat loves to hide behind the blinds and surprise us.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the blinds cast long shadows across the floor.
meanings.sent5: The blinds rattled in the wind, creating a spooky atmosphere in the room.

meanings.definition: A type of poker where players place bets without seeing their cards.
meanings.sent1: In blinds poker, players have to bet without knowing their hand.
meanings.sent2: He decided to fold when he saw his cards in blinds poker.
meanings.sent3: Playing blinds poker feels like a game of chance more than skill.
meanings.sent4: The tension rises as the players in blinds poker wait to reveal their cards.
meanings.sent5: Blinds poker adds an element of mystery and excitement to the game.

meanings.sent1: The bright light blinds me when I step outside.
meanings.sent2: She used her hand to blinds him during the surprise party.
meanings.sent3: His flashy outfit seemed to blinds everyone at the event.
meanings.sent4: The fog was so thick it seemed to blinds the drivers on the road.
meanings.sent5: The magician's trick was to blinds the audience with a sudden burst of light.

meanings.sent1: The con artist tried to blinds the old lady with a fake investment scheme.
meanings.sent2: He didn't want to blinds his friends about his true intentions.
meanings.sent3: The fake news story was meant to blinds the public about the truth.
meanings.sent4: Her charming smile could blinds anyone into believing her lies.
meanings.sent5: The mirage in the desert can easily blinds weary travelers looking for water.
